revised_title: Thermometrical Observations in Allahabad and During a Voyage from Madras to England
tldr: This article presents thermometrical observations made by Sir Robert Barker in Allahabad, East Indies, in 1767, and during a voyage from Madras to England in 1774. The observations reveal the temperature variations in different locations and times of the day, as well as the weather patterns and climate in the regions. The author also discusses the effects of the monsoon season on the Ganges River and the surrounding areas.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Meteorology
